trans-unit.source: Typically, component information does not change for the life of a process.
During design time, however, you can change the component's properties or events.
As a result, the component's information in <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> becomes out-of-date, and a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.Refreshed> event is raised.
A <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.Refreshed> event is also raised when a <xref:System.Type> is changed during design time.
A RefreshEventArgs object specifies the data associated with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.Refreshed> event; that is, the component and the type of component that changed.

The RefreshEventArgs class provides <xref:System.ComponentModel.RefreshEventArgs.ComponentChanged%2A> and <xref:System.ComponentModel.RefreshEventArgs.TypeChanged%2A> properties to get the component or type that raised the event.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.RefreshEventArgs"></xref> class with the component that has changed.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.RefreshEventArgs"></xref> class with the type of component that has changed.
Gets the component that changed its properties, events, or extenders.
The component that changed its properties, events, or extenders, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if all components of the same type have changed.
Gets the <xref:System.Type> that changed its properties or events.
The <xref:System.Type> that changed its properties or events.
